Class IndexHashTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • IndexHashTable

  • public class IndexHashTable
extends java.lang.Object
    Since:
    2014-05-02

    CS3810 Assignment 4 External Hashing

    Class: IndexHashTabe

    This Class implements an Index Hash Table and performs Insert, Search & Delete function

    Author:
    Cyril Thomas

    • Constructor Detail

      • IndexHashTable

        public IndexHashTable(int newSize,
              int newMaxRecord)
        Parameters:
        newSize - : int newSize which is the arraySize.
        newMaxRecord - : int newMaxRecord which is the maxRecord.
        Description:
        This Constructor creates the hash Array table which is then filled with number in order till n-1. Then the Array is converted to List and then Collection Shuffle method is called on the hashArrayList. After that the List is converted back to the array.

    • Method Detail

      • hashFunc

        public int hashFunc(int key)
        Parameters:
        key - : Accepts any integer value
        Returns:
        key mod arraySize.
        Description:
        This method is an hash function.

      • insert

        public int insert(java.io.RandomAccessFile file,
         Record rec)
           throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Parameters:
        file - : Random Access File which Record.toString is written using the Record.write function.
        rec - : Record to be inserted
        Returns:
        0 if successfully written; -1 if the table is full; 1 if there is Redundancy.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException -
        Description:
        For a given record the id is parsed into an integer. Then the Hash Function is Applied. The value from the hash Function is used as an index of the Array. Then from the value of the hash Array[index] is used to calculate the start address by multiply it with maxRecord and 40 which is the total size of an record. Then a Collision test is run for to compare if the value already exist or another value is occupying the space or if the file block is empty by looking for the value "DDDD". If a "DDDD" value is found the Object rec.toString is written to the file and 0 is returned. If the block already has a different value other than the current Record rec then the Start Address is increased by 40 each time until an empty space is found. If an empty block cannot be found then -1 is returned. If there is duplicate values then 1 is returned for redundancy.

      • search

        public java.lang.String search(java.io.RandomAccessFile file,
                      java.lang.String newId)
        Parameters:
        file - : Random Access File to search existing record.
        newId - : String key value to look for.
        Returns:
        String "Found" with the existing record.toString or "Not Found."
        Description:
        Same as the insert method except when the block is found. The id value inside the block is used to compare to the key if they match then the existing record.toString with the message found is returned. If not matching the message not found is returned.

      • delete

        public java.lang.String delete(java.io.RandomAccessFile file,
                      java.lang.String newId)
        Parameters:
        file - : Random Access File to which existing values are to be overwritten by "DDD..".
        newId - : String Key value to look for.
        Returns:
        the deleted record.toString or "Not Found".
        Description:
        Same as the search method except when the matching values are found. Then the block is over written by "DDDD..." if not found the "Not found" message is returned to the user. To note: a block with DDD values indicate that the block is empty.
